channel.title: Making a username Character limit?
channel.description: How would i make a username character limit? If you could just give me the statement that would be great ill find out where to put it on my own

item.title: Making a username Character limit?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You should not rely on a client-side modification for this. Anyone can modify the client, but only you should be able to modify the server.

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:3, topic:470454”]if(playerName.length > whatever) { returnCode = whatever }

Should be something like that server sided, or you could do it client sided like the post above me[/quote]

Would be a quick way to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a username Character limit?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

if(playerName.length > whatever) { returnCode = whatever }

Should be something like that server sided, or you could do it client sided like the post above me

Read full topic

item.title: Making a username Character limit?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I don’t exactly know what it means, but this is what I found in a deltascape client. Hope it helps!

if(anInt1216 == 0) { if(l1 == 8 && aString1173.length() > 0) aString1173 = aString1173.substring(0, aString1173.length() - 1); if(l1 == 9 || l1 == 10 || l1 == 13) anInt1216 = 1; if(flag1) aString1173 += (char)l1; if(aString1173.length() > 12) aString1173 = aString1173.substring(0, 12); } else

Edit: I think this part

if(flag1) aString1173 += (char)l1; if(aString1173.length() > 12) aString1173 = aString1173.substring(0, 12);
Is what you’re looking for.

Read full topic
